sense.name: written record
sense.commentary: accounting entry, ledger entry - an item in a written record
sense.examples: Suzy's diary entry tonight will be full of juicy gossip. One credit entry can debit two budget categories.

sense.name: appearance
sense.commentary: ENTRY[+event] introduction, debut, first appearance, launching, unveiling - the act of beginning something new
sense.examples: They looked forward to the entry of their new product line.

sense.name: submission
sense.commentary: something (manuscripts, architectural plans, models, estimates, or works of art) submitted for the judgement of others (as in a competition)
sense.examples: Several of his entries were rejected by publishers. What was the date of submission of your last entry. She dropped her bake-off entry on the ground moments before the competition.

sense.name: doorway
sense.commentary: entrance, entranceway, entryway, entree - something that provides access (entry or exit)
sense.examples: The entrance to John's bedroom was only four feet tall because he was living in some else's storage space. They waited at the entrance to the garden. The entry was blocked by several large boxes.

sense.name: act of entering
sense.commentary: ENTRY[+event] entrance, entering, ingress, incoming - the act of entering
sense.examples: John's conspicuous entry diverted everyone's attention away from the teacher. She made a grand entrance.
